segments.text: I'm watching the boy on that stool, and it's making me anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool itself looks quite old and unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Its legs are splayed out, almost like it's about to collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching so far up for those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His balance seems incredibly precarious right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see it tilting backward, just slightly, but enough to worry me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Any moment now, that boy could come tumbling down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's holding a plate too, which just adds to the balancing act.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm surprised he hasn't fallen already, given how much he's stretching.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just focused on the cookies, bless her heart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone really needs to steady that stool for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This situation feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
